title: High Female Representation in Primary Education
description: In 2023, 99.5% of primary education teachers in Belarus were female, showcasing a strong female presence in the educational workforce.

title: Exceptional Educational Attainment for Women
description: By 2023, 98.2% of Belarusian women aged 25 and older had completed at least upper secondary education, indicating high educational achievement among females.

title: Low Maternal Mortality Ratio
description: Belarus reported a maternal mortality ratio of just 1 per 100,000 live births in 2023, reflecting excellent maternal healthcare.

title: Minimal Early Marriage Among Women
description: As of 2019, only 0.1% of Belarusian women aged 20-24 were married by age 15, indicating low prevalence of child marriage.

title: Significant Income Share for Lowest 10%
description: In 2020, the lowest 10% of income earners in Belarus held 4.5% of the national income, suggesting a relatively equitable income distribution.

title: High Educational Attainment in Population
description: By 2023, 97.9% of the Belarusian population aged 25 and older had completed at least upper secondary education, highlighting widespread educational achievement.

title: Low Net Bilateral Aid Flows
description: In 2022, Belarus experienced a net outflow of bilateral aid amounting to -$102.24 million, indicating a negative balance in aid received.

title: Negative Carbon Dioxide Flux from Deforestation
description: Belarus reported a net flux of -3.26 Mt CO2e from deforestation in 2022, reflecting a reduction in carbon emissions from land use change.

title: Minimal Private School Enrollment in Primary Education
description: In 2023, only 0.01% of primary school students in Belarus were enrolled in private institutions, indicating a predominantly public education system.

title: Low Labor Force with Basic Education Among Males
description: As of 2023, only 17.8% of the male working-age population in Belarus had basic education, suggesting a need for improved educational opportunities for men.

title: Low Lifetime Risk of Maternal Death
description: In 2023, the lifetime risk of maternal death in Belarus was 1 in 96,213, indicating strong maternal health systems.

title: Minimal Lifetime Risk of Maternal Death Percentage
description: The lifetime risk of maternal death in Belarus was 0.001% in 2023, showcasing exceptional maternal healthcare.
